children.text:
Else, same as original (but in the problem, perhaps only letters are considered). So in Fortran:

function reverse_char(c) result(r)
   character, intent(in) :: c
   character :: r
   if (c >= 'a' .and. c <= 'z') then
      r = achar(ichar(c) - 32)
   else if (c >= 'A' .and. c <= 'Z') then
      r = achar(ichar(c) + 32)
   else
      r = c
   end if
end function

program main
   implicit none
   character(len=1000) :: s, t
   integer :: ura = 0, opa = 0
   integer :: t_counts(0:255) = 0
   logical :: used(1000) = .false. integer :: i, len_s, len_t
   character(len=20) :: first_output
   integer :: counts(0:255) = 0
   logical :: ok = .true.
   character(len=4) :: second_result
   character(len=4) :: third_result

   !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Read input
   read(*, '(A)') s
   read(*, '(A)') t

   ! Process first program
   len_s = len_trim(s)
   len_t = len_trim(t)

   ! Initialize t_counts
   do i = 1, len_t
      t_counts(ichar(t(i:i))) = t_counts(ichar(t(i:i))) + 1
   end do

   ! First loop for ura
   do i = 1, len_s
      character :: c = s(i:i)
      integer :: ic = ichar(c) if (t_counts(ic) > 0) then
         ura = ura + 1
         t_counts(ic) = t_counts(ic) - 1
         used(i) = .true.
      end if
   end do

   ! Second loop for opa
   do i = 1, len_s
      character :: current_char
      if (used(i)) then
         current_char = achar(1071) ! 'Я' in ASCII?

program main
   implicit none
   character(len=1000) :: s, t
   integer :: ura = 0, opa = 0
   integer :: t_counts(0:255) = 0
   logical :: used(1000) = .false.
   integer :: i, len_s, len_t
   character(len=20) :: first_output
   integer :: counts(0:255) = 0
   logical :: ok = .true.
   character(len=4) :: second_result
   character(len=4) :: third_result
